titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol building and grounds for events to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the laying of the cornerstone of the Capitol.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E2483)

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/15/1993--Introduced. Permits the Commission on the Bicentennial of the United States Capitol to use the Capitol building and grounds on October 23, 1993, for events to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the laying of the cornerstone of the Capitol.
